description: Borrowed from New Latin ptilÄ«num, itself an adaptation of the French ptiline.

entries.meaning: (zoology, entomology) A bladder-like pouch on the head of schizophoran flies that by expanding enables the fly to emerge from its puparium.
examples: As for the structure of the ptilinum itself, Strickland (1953) reported that the ptilina of Conopidae 'are voluminous and represent the most rugged type of ptilinum which we have encountered'.
